Class DecisionTreeSimulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • DecisionTreeSimulation

  • public class DecisionTreeSimulation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class simulates the decision tree recursively. In other words build by recursive calls a tree that exhausts all possibilities of the game and than chooses the most desirable one.
    Author:
    Milan Kovacic

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DecisionTreeSimulation()

      Simulates recursion call on a new player (simulatedPlayer) that got the token passed, with lower depth (newDepth) and gets another parameter (node) to have the information to call recursion properly
      (package private) static void simulationDecisionTree(Node node, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer[]> finalNumbers)
      Recursive method used to build a decision tree for every single step in simulation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DecisionTreeSimulation

        DecisionTreeSimulation()

    • Method Detail

      • simulationDecisionTree

        static void simulationDecisionTree(Node node,
                                   java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer[]> finalNumbers)
        Recursive method used to build a decision tree for every single step in simulation. At every iteration it calls the number of players recursive calls. The number of calls therefore grows exponentially. This is performed to desired depth.
        Parameters:
        node - object that carries all needed information of the recursion call
        finalNumbers - array list of all the terminal tree leafs
        See Also:
        see the class if deeper understending of the recursion is required

      • simulateSubTrees

        static void simulateSubTrees(Node node,
                             int newDepth,
                             int simulatedPlayer,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer[]> finalNumbers)
        Simulates recursion call on a new player (simulatedPlayer) that got the token passed, with lower depth (newDepth) and gets another parameter (node) to have the information to call recursion properly
        Parameters:
        simulatedPlayer - is a player that got the ball passed
        node - object that carries information about the state of recursion
        newDepth - the depth of recursion calls
        finalNumbers - array list of all the terminal tree leafs

      • findMax

        static int findMax(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer[]> finalNumbers)
        Method takes arrayList searches it and gives the best possible next step. If there are more options that have the same utility value, the method always chooses the last one (in respect to search order).
        Parameters:
        finalNumbers - array list of all the terminal tree leafs
        Returns:
        returnValue integer represents the best possible solution for the next step
